greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Moebius transform applied thrice to sequence 1,0,0,0,....
comment: Dirichlet inverse of A007425. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 15 2010
abs(a(n)) is the number of ways to write n=xyz where x,y,z are squarefree numbers. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Jan 02 2018
reference: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
link: Enrique Pérez Herrero, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(s) = (-3)^A001221(s) provided s is a squarefree number (A005117). (End)
maple: möbius := proc(a)  local b, i, mo: b := NULL:
for i to nops(a) do b := b, add(mo(i,j)*a[j], j=1..i) od: [b] end:
mathematica: a[n_] := Which[n==1, 1, PrimeQ[n], -3, True, Times @@ Map[Function[e, Binomial[3, e] (-1)^e], FactorInteger[n][[All, 2]]]];
program: [a007318' 3 e * cycle [1,-1] !! fromIntegral e | e <- a124010_row n]
(PARI) a(n) = {my(f=factor(n)); for (k=1, #f~, e = f[k,2]; f[k,1] = binomial(3, e)*(-1)^e; f[k,2] = 1); factorback(f);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jan 03 2018
(PARI) for(n=1, 100, print1(direuler(p=2, n, (1 - X)^3)[n], ", ")) \\ _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 22 2021
xref: Consecutive nested Dirichlet convolution: A063524, A008683 or A007427. - _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Jul 12 2010
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
